    public class MainPanel
extends AutoPanel
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    This is the MainPanel class, which implements the main ui elements.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MainPanel

        public MainPanel(javax.swing.JFrame frame)
        This is the MainPanel constructor. It initializes the ui, using the menuBarSetup and tableSetup methods.
        Parameters:
        frame - the frame that hosts the panel, used to setup the JMenuBar.

      • menuBarSetup

        private void menuBarSetup(javax.swing.JFrame frame)
        This is the MainPanel menuBarSetup method. It initializes the JMenuBar.
        Parameters:
        frame - the frame that hosts the panel.

      • tableSetup

        private void tableSetup()
        This is the MainPanel tableSetup method. It initializes the JTable.

      • addToTable

        private void addToTable(JobDescriptor j)
        This is the MainPanel addToTable method. It adds a row to the JTable.
        Parameters:
        j - the JobDescriptor that needs to be represented.

      • chooserGetFile

        private java.lang.String chooserGetFile(AutoPanel options,
                                        java.lang.String title,
                                        boolean only_folders)
        This is the MainPanel chooserGetFile method. It spawns a CustomChooser that is then used to return the path of the target using a string. If the CustomChooser is closed, it signals the error.
        Parameters:
        options - the optional AutoPanel that can be used to interact with the user.
        title - the title of the CustomChooser.
        only_folders - if true, only folders will be displayed.
        Returns:
        the path of the target.

      • chooserGetMultipleFiles

        private java.lang.String[] chooserGetMultipleFiles(AutoPanel options,
                                                   java.lang.String title,
                                                   boolean only_folders)
        This is the MainPanel chooserGetMultipleFiles method. It spawns a CustomChooser that is then used to return the paths of the targets using a string vector. If the CustomChooser is closed, it signals the error.
        Parameters:
        options - the optional AutoPanel that can be used to interact with the user.
        title - the title of the CustomChooser.
        only_folders - if true, only folders will be displayed.
        Returns:
        vector containing the paths of the targets.

      • createArchive

        private void createArchive()
                    throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This is the MainPanel createArchive method. It handles the creation of JobDescriptor aimed at the creation of archives and it spawns CustomChoosers.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • openArchive

        private void openArchive()
                  throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This is the MainPanel openArchive method. It handles the creation of JobDescriptor aimed at the dearchiving of archives and it spawns CustomChoosers.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        This is the MainPanel actionPerformed method. It reacts to changes to the ui, and runs specific features.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        e - the event.

      • deleteJob

        private void deleteJob(int index)
        This is the MainPanel deleteJob method. Given an index, it disables the job and marks it as cancelled on the table.
        Parameters:
        index - the index.

      • modJob

        private void modJob(int index)
        This is the MainPanel modJob method. Given an index, it disables the job and marks it as cancelled on the table. It then proceeds to create a new one.
        Parameters:
        index - the index.

      • runAllJobs

        private void runAllJobs()
        This is the MainPanel runAllJobs method. It runs all the jobs that haven't been deleted or completed.
